dlgLine.text: I'm sure it won't come as a shock, but morale among the survivors here has plummeted as of late.
If we don't turn things around, there's a good possibility that people may leave, stop cooperating, rebel, or even give up.
For this place to hold together, we need to do something immediately to boost morale. Suggestions?
I can't help but think that we're partially to blame for this. We're responsible for these people and they're no longer confident that we're going to be able to protect them.
We need to take their minds off of our recent troubles - give 'em some relief, even if it's just for a day or two.
<To you> Maybe you got something. Whatever it is, I'm on board with it.
These folks have been through a lot. Maybe we should use some of our food to give them a few decent meals for a change.
I've seen morale issues take down some of the bravest soldiers I knew. This is a serious issue, and without some relief - something to keep them fighting for - we're going to lose them.

Back in the army, soldiers needed to be reminded of home - of what they were fighting for. As much as I hate to say it, we need to give them a sense that there's something out there... some organization, some sense of normalcy. Even if we have to exaggerate the truth.
<To you>Most of all, people need to see their leaders united. You've got my vote, whatever you decide.
We need to give people hope... but we all have to be prepared to bend the truth a little for the good of this place.
This is psych ops 101. You control the truth - they listen to you. Tell them what they want to hear.
All you need is some spin. Most people will believe whatever an authority figure tells them.
<To you> You seem to know what these people want. You've got my vote either way.
Just tell them you heard a radio broadcast promising a relief drop soon. I'll even do it, if you need me to.
I'm sick of hearing them complain, frankly. These people aren't survivors - they're just lucky enough to have not died before they got here.
Frankly, we don't need to do anything. Either we find some shit today that makes 'em all cheery again or the worst of the bunch fuck off out of here on their own.
<To you> They'll probably blame you, whatever you decide. But fuck 'em, I got your back.
Shit has a way of working itself out. Like, you know, people offing themselves.
I know that from my discussions with some of my friends here that they feel that the need to constantly ration food reminds them of how different their lives are now.

If they had one day of indulgence - where they could eat until they were full - it might reinvigorate them. Our church picnics definitely used to raise the spirits of some of the less fortunate members of my congregation.
<To you> Whatever you choose to do, I'm willing to show solidarity with the leadership.
When things were pretty bad, Jesus held a feast. I think the idea we can take away from that is it can bring people together in the face of adversity.
There's no pleasing some people - that's what I learned in my time in public office.
These people always want more, more, more - well, I say we just let them work harder if they want more. Get them out there and have them bring back what we need!
<To you> However, if you need me to help you support your idea, I'm willing to throw a vote your way this time.
We don't need drastic action. We need to get out there today and bring back a win for this place.
<To you> It's time to make a decision. What should we do?

dlgAnsw.text: We will wait and see. We'll focus on securing more supplies that will help morale.
We need to give them hope... We'll spread the word that a government relief drop might be coming this way.
We will prepare a large amount of food and let people eat more than normal. <-50 food>
I know that these people listen to you and I will let you split 40 rations if you start singing my praises. <-40 food>
I propose we give everyone the day off today. We could all use a break.
We have some bad influences spoiling it for everyone. I'll find a more immediate way to deal with them.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to do nothing immediately and to make finding basic luxuries a priority. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: I'm not certain I agree with this one, but... are we okay with endorsing a lie to give people hope?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give people access to a large amount of food immediately. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: I'm not sure I agree with this, but the proposal is to let the leadership take rations in return for using their influence to raise the morale around here. Is this really what you'd like to do?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give everyone today off - whether you join us is up to you. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The decision is to keep looking for more supplies that might boost morale.
I guess it couldn't hurt to try... So, you've got my support.
This is just more of the same... With a situation this bad, you need to show some damn initiative! Our goodwill is GONE, do you understand that?!
I don't know how this fixes anything, but I'm willing to lend my support to help get us back on track.
So we're not going to do anything? Stay the course, right? The leadership equivalent of hiding under a blanket and hoping things will just work themselves out.
Yeah... okay. I guess I can play along, but try not to put me in this spot again, 'kay?
It's supposed to be bread AND circuses. If you don't provide a distraction, they're sure as hell to come up with one involving rope and sticks - and no, I'm not talking about pinatas.
Exactly. Way things are, won't be much longer before some of the sadder sacks help themselves to a heaping portion of buckshot. Way less complaining to deal with.
Exactly. Way things are, won't be much longer before some of the sadder sacks help themselves to a heaping portion of buckshot. Way less complaining to deal with.
I'd rather we gave them something more immediate, but... I'll see what I can do to make them understand.
This isn't tending to the needs of the people here at all. Honestly, there's very little I can't do to keep reassuring them that things will get better.
I'm glad you understand. All this needs is a little effort on all parts and we can get over this rut we're in.
I'm glad you understand. All this needs is a little effort on all parts and we can get over this rut we're in.
The decision is for us to perpetuate the rumor that a government relief drop was talked about on the radio.
I'm not comfortable with this... but I'll go along with it if you really want me to.
This is a straight-up lie! I refuse to participate in this. You're all on your own.

I know it's a difficult choice, but we need people to believe it's a possibility. And who knows, maybe we'll get lucky in the next few weeks and actually receive confirmation that someone's out there.

I know it's a difficult choice, but we need people to believe it's a possibility. And who knows, maybe we'll get lucky in the next few weeks and actually receive confirmation that someone's out there.
It's the truth if we make it the truth. For now on, they'll go to bed thinking that tomorrow will be the day when everything gets better.
It's the truth if we make it the truth. For now on, they'll go to bed thinking that tomorrow will be the day when everything gets better.
Huh... You know, that just might work. That's pretty damn clever.
Huh... You know, that just might work. That's pretty damn clever.
I realize that desperate times require desperate measures... if this is really what we need to do, I'll cooperate.
I don't think lying to everyone is an option. This is a lie to benefit us, not them. It goes against everything I preach and I refuse to take part in it.
I think this might backfire, but... I'll go along with it if that's what you want.
So instead of doing nothing new, you want to do nothing and create a scenario that might possibly backfire on us? You know, I've had to stretch the truth as a politician, but this is pure nonsense!
The decision is to give everyone extra food immediately.
It's the right thing to do. If there's anything that can bring people together, it's sitting around a full table and not worrying about where your next meal's coming from.
It's the right thing to do. If there's anything that can bring people together, it's sitting around a full table and not worrying about where your next meal's coming from.
I don't know if it's a wise use of our food, but I'll back you on this decision because you've considered my solutions in the past.
This is a temporary measure. And if we're not careful, our food supply will become an even bigger problem. You think people are unhappy now, try dealing with them when they're starving.
I don't usually object to food, but this seems a bit frivolous. I'll support this for the sake of our partnership, but try not to be so careless in the future.
What are you doing? There are easier ways to do this without sacrificing our food supply. This is a panic button solution.
Pretty damn wasteful... Still, guess I get my share of that, so I won't complain.
Why the hell would you give them all that food? Do you remember how much work it took to get that?! These whiners want to feel full, I'll ram my boot up their ass!
Thank you for seeing things that way. If there's one thing that can unite people, it's sitting down to a big meal together.
Thank you for seeing things that way. If there's one thing that can unite people, it's sitting down to a big meal together.
This isn't the solution that I hoped for, but you've supported me in the past, so I'll back you on this one.
This is a waste of resources! They're just going to complain again when we go back to rationing their supply.
I'm not going to include myself in this, but the deal is if we split food, each one of us will be responsible for personally boosting faith in the leadership and raising morale around here.
You're really putting me on the spot, but if that's what you need, I'll support you. Just don't expect any favors from me for a while.
I'm make this clear and simple for you - I ain't the kind of man who takes a bribe!
Given our history, I would have just given you my support... Please don't put me in this position again.
So... a bribe? Are you really that desperate?
I'm okay with this. You got yourself a spin doctor.
I'm okay with this. You got yourself a spin doctor.
I like you more already. Don't worry - I'll keep my half of the bargain.
I like you more already. Don't worry - I'll keep my half of the bargain.
I don't need this, but some of the people here could use the extra food, and I'll be sure to tell them who was responsible for it.
I don't need this, but some of the people here could use the extra food, and I'll be sure to tell them who was responsible for it.
I can do a lot more with this to incentivize the right parties than if you had just given it all away with no strings attached. I think we're all going to appreciate the results.
I can do a lot more with this to incentivize the right parties than if you had just given it all away with no strings attached. I think we're all going to appreciate the results.
The decision is to give everyone a day off to relax.
This is still giving back to the people here, so I'm all for it. And honestly, I think we've all earned a day off.
This is still giving back to the people here, so I'm all for it. And honestly, I think we've all earned a day off.
Even the military gave time off, and these people aren't soldiers. Sure, I approve of this.
Even the military gave time off, and these people aren't soldiers. Sure, I approve of this.
As long as someone remembers to poke their head over the fence from time to time, I'm for this.
As long as someone remembers to poke their head over the fence from time to time, I'm for this.
I think you're being too soft on them, but shit, I'll take a day off.
They're already too soft and you're not helping things. We're just going to have to make up for lost time tomorrow.
It's about time we had a day of rest, no matter what's happening in the world right now. I'm not sure some of these people could take the stress of one more day past the gates.
It's about time we had a day of rest, no matter what's happening in the world right now. I'm not sure some of these people could take the stress of one more day past the gates.
I think you're giving into pressure too easily, but since I owe it to you, I'll support you on this.
We have to be on our guard at all times! You're buying their affection at the expense of this shelter's security!
The decision is to... find a way to decisively deal with the indviduals with the worst morale.
When you say that, I really hope that means you're going to encourage one of the troublemakers to leave.

You're going to what? Why don't you have the guts to just come out and say what you mean?! Because I swear, if I think you've taken one of our own out intentionally, I'm going to come down on you hard!
I've got to believe that you've actually got a plan and that you're not saying what I think you're saying.
Why don't you be honest and say you're going to kill them? Because I'm happy to be honest with you and say that if you do that, your leadership days here are over.
Sometimes desperate people kill themselves. And sometimes, you do the right thing and spare them the trouble of taking their own life.
Sometimes desperate people kill themselves. And sometimes, you do the right thing and spare them the trouble of taking their own life.
I know, you're all looking at me and wondering if I agree. I really don't, but then, I kind of like how things are going here otherwise.
That's pretty low, and I say that as someone who once showed a man his own balls.
I'm really not sure what to think here... I want to believe you will do what's right for all of these people.
That is one of the worst things I've ever heard.
I suppose you might find someone who wants to leave... I mean, given your past decisions, that's what I hope you're saying.
This is not strong leadership - this is barbaric! There's no way you should be running this place if that's your solution!
That concludes our meeting... Hopefully, our situation will improve in the near future.
